instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
UB400 -all LDOs except PP1V1 UPC TB LDO BMC
UB300 -all LDO s ok
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>-all LDO s ok
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>-all LDO s ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
I reprogrammed UB090 still same
no water damage/corrosion
all resistance and traces looks fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
You have a problem on UB400 area.
Did you change it?
Compare diode mode readings around it with other port.

Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> level.
Tested with known good (charged) battery?
